ns0:StringWithMarkup.ns0:String: LC50; Species: Cyprinodon variegatus (Sheepshead minnow, juvenile, length 6-17 mm); Conditions: freshwater, static, 22 °C, pH 7.6-7.9, hardness 25-50 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 25-50 mg/L CaCO3; Concentration: >220 ug/L for 96 hr /> or = 95% purity/

LC50; Species: Lepomis macrochirus (Bluegill, juvenile, length 29-40 mm); Conditions: freshwater, static, 22 °C, pH 7.6-7.9, hardness 25-50 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 25-50 mg/L CaCO3; Concentration: >730 ug/L for 96 hr /> or = 95% purity/

LC50 Lepomis macrochirus (bluegill) >1 mg/L (limit of solubility)/96 hr; Conditions: static, hardness 42 to 48 mg/L, alkalinity 30 to 34 mg/L, pH 7.7 to 7.9, specific conductance 150 to 160 umhos/cm, dissolved oxygen levels 89 to 100%, 22 + or - 1 °C.

LC50 Oncorhynchus mykiss (rainbow trout, mean length = 39 mm and mean wet weight = 0.6 g) > 1.4 mg/L/96 hr; Conditions: flow through, 11 + or - 1 °C, pH 7.1 to 7.5, dissolved oxygen 9.8 to 10.0 mg/L, total hardness and alkalinity as CaCO3 20 to 26 mg/L and 14 to 22 mg/L.

LC50; Species: Pimephales promelas (Fathead minnow, juvenile, length 29-40 mm); Conditions: freshwater, static, 22 °C, pH 7.6-7.9, hardness 25-50 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 25-50 mg/L CaCO3; Concentration: >740 ug/L for 96 hr /> or = 95% purity/

LC50 Pimephales promelas (fathead minnow) >0.96 mg/L (limit of solubility)/96 hr; Conditions: static, hardness 42 to 48 mg/L, alkalinity 30 to 36 mg/L (as CaCO3), pH 7.3 to 7.8, specific conductance 150 to 170 umhos/cm, dissolved oxygen levels 7.1 to 8.8 mg/L (81 to 100% saturation), 22 °C.

EC50 Daphnia magna (water flea, < 24 hours old) > 0.02 mg/L/48 hr; Conditions: static, 20 °C, pH 8.2 to 8.3, dissolved oxygen 8.3 to 8.9 mg/L, total hardness as CaCO3 150 to 170 mg/L; Effect: immobility.

EC50 Daphnia magna (water flea) > 0.9 mg/L/21 days; Conditions: soln renewed 3 times/wk, Temperature = 20 + or - 1.0 °C, Water hardness = >140 mg/L (as CaC03), Alkalinity = >100 mg/L (as CaC03), pH = approx 8, Dissolved oxygen = 8-9 mg/L; Effect: reproduction rate. /Purity >99.5%/

EC50 Daphnia magna (water flea) > 0.059 mg/L (highest achievable water solubility)/21 days; Conditions: flow-through, Temperature = 21 + or - 2.0 °C, Water hardness = 150 to 180 mg/L (as CaC03), Alkalinity = 100 to 130 mg/L (as CaC03), pH = 7.9 to 8.3, Dissolved oxygen > 60% saturation, Specific conductance = 400 to 600 umho/cm; Effect: reproduction rate.

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, static, 20-23 °C, pH 7.0-8.5, hardness 120-250 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 120-250 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 6.0-9.3 mg/L; Concentration: 48000 ug/L for 24 hr; Effect: intoxication, immobilization /formulated product/

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, renewal, 21-23 °C, pH 7.2-8.5, hardness 240-310 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 200-260 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 5.0-7.5 mg/L; Concentration: 17700 ug/L for 14 days; Effect: intoxication, immobilization

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, renewal, 21-23 °C, pH 7.2-8.5, hardness 240-310 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 200-260 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 5.0-7.5 mg/L; Concentration: 12000 ug/L for 48 hr; Effect: intoxication, immobilization

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, static, 20-23 °C, pH 7.0-8.5, hardness 120-250 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 120-250 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 6.0-9.3 mg/L; Concentration: 15000 ug/L for 48 hr; Effect: intoxication, immobilization

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, renewal, 21-23 °C, pH 7.2-8.5, hardness 240-310 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 200-260 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 5.0-7.5 mg/L; Concentration: 12400 ug/L for 21 days; Effect: intoxication, immobilization

EC50; Species: Daphnia magna (Water flea, age <24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, renewal, 21-23 °C, pH 7.2-8.5, hardness 240-310 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 200-260 mg/L CaCO3, dissolved oxygen 5.0-7.5 mg/L; Concentration: >12000 ug/L for 7 days; Effect: intoxication, immobilization

EC50 Selenastrum capricornutum (green algae) > 2.1 mg/L/8 days; Conditions: static, Lighting = 4,700 lux, Test temperature = 22 + or - 2 °C, pH 7.5 at initiation and 8.3 on day 8; Effect: cell numbers and in-vivo chlorophyll a.

EC50; Species: Pseudokirchneriella subcapitata (Green algae); Conditions: freshwater, static, 22-24 °C, pH 7.6-7.9, hardness 25-50 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 25-50 mg/L CaCO3; Concentration: >2100 ug/L for 96 hr; Effect: decreased population abundance /> or = 95% purity/

EC50; Species: Americamysis bahia (Opossum shrimp, age < or =24 hr); Conditions: freshwater, static, 20 °C, pH 7.6-7.9, hardness 25-50 mg/L CaCO3, alkalinity 25-50 mg/L CaCO3; Concentration: >290 ug/L for 96 hr; Effect: mortality /> or = 95% purity/
